name: dex
description: A Pulumi provider for managing Dex resources via the Dex gRPC Admin API

caCert.description: PEM-encoded CA certificate for validating Dex's TLS certificate.

clientCert.description: PEM-encoded client certificate for mTLS to Dex.

clientKey.description: PEM-encoded private key for the client certificate.

insecureSkipVerify.description: If true, disables TLS verification (development only).

timeoutSeconds.description: Per-RPC timeout in seconds when talking to Dex.

teams.description: List of team names within the organization. If empty, all members of the organization can authenticate.

emailKey.description: The OIDC claim key that contains the user's email address.

groupsKey.description: The OIDC claim key that contains the user's group memberships.

claimMapping.description: Mapping of OIDC claims to Dex user attributes.

extra.description: Additional OIDC configuration fields as key-value pairs.

insecureIssuer.description: If true, skip verification of the issuer URL. Not recommended for production.

insecureSkipEmailVerified.description: If true, skip verification of the 'email_verified' claim. Not recommended for production.

redirectUri.description: The redirect URI registered with the OIDC provider. Must match Dex's callback URL.

scopes.description: List of OIDC scopes to request (e.g., 'openid', 'profile', 'email'). Defaults to ['openid', 'profile', 'email'] if not specified.

userNameKey.description: The claim key to use as the username (e.g., 'preferred_username', 'email', 'sub').

caCert.description: PEM-encoded CA certificate for validating Dex's TLS certificate.

clientCert.description: PEM-encoded client certificate for mTLS to Dex.

clientKey.description: PEM-encoded private key for the client certificate.

caCert.description: PEM-encoded CA certificate for validating Dex's TLS certificate.

clientCert.description: PEM-encoded client certificate for mTLS to Dex.

clientKey.description: PEM-encoded private key for the client certificate.

insecureSkipVerify.description: If true, disables TLS verification (development only).

timeoutSeconds.description: Per-RPC timeout in seconds when talking to Dex.

dex:resources:AzureMicrosoftConnector.description: Manages an Azure AD/Entra ID connector in Dex using the Microsoft-specific connector (type: microsoft). This connector provides Microsoft-specific features like group filtering and domain restrictions.

connectorId.description: Unique identifier for the Azure Microsoft connector.

groups.description: Name of the claim that contains group memberships (e.g., 'groups'). Used for group-based access control.

name.description: Human-readable name for the connector, displayed to users during login.

redirectUri.description: Redirect URI registered in Azure AD. Must match Dex's callback URL.

tenant.description: Azure AD tenant identifier. Can be 'common' (any Azure AD account), 'organizations' (any organizational account), or a specific tenant ID (UUID format).

connectorId.description: Unique identifier for the Azure Microsoft connector.

groups.description: Name of the claim that contains group memberships (e.g., 'groups'). Used for group-based access control.

name.description: Human-readable name for the connector, displayed to users during login.

redirectUri.description: Redirect URI registered in Azure AD. Must match Dex's callback URL.

tenant.description: Azure AD tenant identifier. Can be 'common' (any Azure AD account), 'organizations' (any organizational account), or a specific tenant ID (UUID format).

dex:resources:AzureOidcConnector.description: Manages an Azure AD/Entra ID connector in Dex using the generic OIDC connector (type: oidc). This connector allows users to authenticate using their Azure AD/Entra ID credentials.

connectorId.description: Unique identifier for the Azure connector.

extraOidc.description: Additional OIDC configuration fields as key-value pairs for advanced scenarios.

name.description: Human-readable name for the connector, displayed to users during login.

redirectUri.description: Redirect URI registered in Azure AD. Must match Dex's callback URL (typically 'https://dex.example.com/callback').

scopes.description: OIDC scopes to request from Azure AD. Defaults to ['openid', 'profile', 'email', 'offline_access'] if not specified.

tenantId.description: Azure AD tenant ID (UUID format). This identifies your Azure AD organization.

userNameSource.description: Source for the username claim. Valid values: 'preferred_username' (default), 'upn' (User Principal Name), or 'email'.

connectorId.description: Unique identifier for the Azure connector.

extraOidc.description: Additional OIDC configuration fields as key-value pairs for advanced scenarios.

name.description: Human-readable name for the connector, displayed to users during login.

redirectUri.description: Redirect URI registered in Azure AD. Must match Dex's callback URL (typically 'https://dex.example.com/callback').

scopes.description: OIDC scopes to request from Azure AD. Defaults to ['openid', 'profile', 'email', 'offline_access'] if not specified.

tenantId.description: Azure AD tenant ID (UUID format). This identifies your Azure AD organization.

userNameSource.description: Source for the username claim. Valid values: 'preferred_username' (default), 'upn' (User Principal Name), or 'email'.

dex:resources:Client.description: Manages an OAuth2 client in Dex. OAuth2 clients are applications that can authenticate users through Dex.

clientId.description: Unique identifier for the OAuth2 client. This is used as the client_id in OAuth2 flows.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the client was created (RFC3339 format).

logoUrl.description: URL to a logo image for the OAuth2 client. Used in consent screens.

name.description: Human-readable name for the OAuth2 client.

public.description: If true, this client is a public client (e.g., mobile app) and does not require a client secret.

redirectUris.description: List of allowed redirect URIs for OAuth2 authorization flows. Must be valid HTTP/HTTPS URLs.

secret.description: Client secret for the OAuth2 client. If not provided, a secure random secret will be generated automatically.

trustedPeers.description: List of trusted peer client IDs that can exchange tokens with this client.

clientId.description: Unique identifier for the OAuth2 client. This is used as the client_id in OAuth2 flows.

logoUrl.description: URL to a logo image for the OAuth2 client. Used in consent screens.

name.description: Human-readable name for the OAuth2 client.

public.description: If true, this client is a public client (e.g., mobile app) and does not require a client secret.

redirectUris.description: List of allowed redirect URIs for OAuth2 authorization flows. Must be valid HTTP/HTTPS URLs.

secret.description: Client secret for the OAuth2 client. If not provided, a secure random secret will be generated automatically.

trustedPeers.description: List of trusted peer client IDs that can exchange tokens with this client.

dex:resources:CognitoOidcConnector.description: Manages an AWS Cognito user pool connector in Dex using the generic OIDC connector (type: oidc). This connector allows users to authenticate using their AWS Cognito credentials.

connectorId.description: Unique identifier for the Cognito connector.

extraOidc.description: Additional OIDC configuration fields as key-value pairs for advanced scenarios.

name.description: Human-readable name for the connector, displayed to users during login.

redirectUri.description: Redirect URI registered in Cognito. Must match Dex's callback URL.

region.description: AWS region where the Cognito user pool is located (e.g., 'us-east-1', 'eu-west-1').

scopes.description: OIDC scopes to request from Cognito. Defaults to ['openid', 'email', 'profile'] if not specified.

userNameSource.description: Source for the username claim. Valid values: 'email' or 'sub' (subject).

connectorId.description: Unique identifier for the Cognito connector.

extraOidc.description: Additional OIDC configuration fields as key-value pairs for advanced scenarios.

name.description: Human-readable name for the connector, displayed to users during login.

redirectUri.description: Redirect URI registered in Cognito. Must match Dex's callback URL.

region.description: AWS region where the Cognito user pool is located (e.g., 'us-east-1', 'eu-west-1').

scopes.description: OIDC scopes to request from Cognito. Defaults to ['openid', 'email', 'profile'] if not specified.

userNameSource.description: Source for the username claim. Valid values: 'email' or 'sub' (subject).

dex:resources:Connector.description: Manages a generic connector (upstream identity provider) in Dex. Use this resource for connectors not covered by specific connector types, or when you need full control over the connector configuration.

name.description: Human-readable name for the connector, displayed to users during login.

oidcConfig.description: OIDC-specific configuration. Use this for OIDC-based connectors.

rawConfig.description: Raw JSON configuration for the connector. Use this for advanced configurations or connector types not directly supported. If provided, this takes precedence over OIDCConfig.

type.description: Type of connector (e.g., 'oidc', 'saml', 'ldap'). Must match a connector type supported by Dex.

name.description: Human-readable name for the connector, displayed to users during login.

oidcConfig.description: OIDC-specific configuration. Use this for OIDC-based connectors.

rawConfig.description: Raw JSON configuration for the connector. Use this for advanced configurations or connector types not directly supported. If provided, this takes precedence over OIDCConfig.

type.description: Type of connector (e.g., 'oidc', 'saml', 'ldap'). Must match a connector type supported by Dex.

dex:resources:GitHubConnector.description: Manages a GitHub connector in Dex. This connector allows users to authenticate using their GitHub accounts and supports organization and team-based access control.

connectorId.description: Unique identifier for the GitHub connector.

hostName.description: GitHub Enterprise hostname (e.g., 'github.example.com'). Leave empty for github.com.

loadAllGroups.description: If true, load all groups (teams) the user is a member of. Defaults to false.

name.description: Human-readable name for the connector, displayed to users during login.

orgs.description: List of GitHub organizations with optional team restrictions. Only users in these orgs/teams will be allowed to authenticate.

preferredEmailDomain.description: Preferred email domain. If set, users with emails in this domain will be preferred.

redirectUri.description: Redirect URI registered in GitHub OAuth app. Must match Dex's callback URL.

rootCA.description: Root CA certificate for GitHub Enterprise (PEM format). Required if using self-signed certificates.

teamNameField.description: Field to use for team names in group claims. Valid values: 'name', 'slug', or 'both'. Defaults to 'slug'.

useLoginAsID.description: If true, use GitHub login username as the user ID. Defaults to false.

connectorId.description: Unique identifier for the GitHub connector.

hostName.description: GitHub Enterprise hostname (e.g., 'github.example.com'). Leave empty for github.com.

loadAllGroups.description: If true, load all groups (teams) the user is a member of. Defaults to false.

name.description: Human-readable name for the connector, displayed to users during login.

orgs.description: List of GitHub organizations with optional team restrictions. Only users in these orgs/teams will be allowed to authenticate.

preferredEmailDomain.description: Preferred email domain. If set, users with emails in this domain will be preferred.

redirectUri.description: Redirect URI registered in GitHub OAuth app. Must match Dex's callback URL.

rootCA.description: Root CA certificate for GitHub Enterprise (PEM format). Required if using self-signed certificates.

teamNameField.description: Field to use for team names in group claims. Valid values: 'name', 'slug', or 'both'. Defaults to 'slug'.

useLoginAsID.description: If true, use GitHub login username as the user ID. Defaults to false.

dex:resources:GitLabConnector.description: Manages a GitLab connector in Dex. This connector allows users to authenticate using their GitLab accounts and supports group-based access control.

baseURL.description: GitLab instance base URL. Defaults to 'https://gitlab.com' for GitLab.com.

connectorId.description: Unique identifier for the GitLab connector.

getGroupsPermission.description: If true, request 'read_api' scope to fetch group memberships. Defaults to false.

groups.description: List of GitLab group names. Only users in these groups will be allowed to authenticate.

name.description: Human-readable name for the connector, displayed to users during login.

redirectUri.description: Redirect URI registered in GitLab OAuth app. Must match Dex's callback URL.

useLoginAsID.description: If true, use GitLab username as the user ID. Defaults to false.

baseURL.description: GitLab instance base URL. Defaults to 'https://gitlab.com' for GitLab.com.

connectorId.description: Unique identifier for the GitLab connector.

getGroupsPermission.description: If true, request 'read_api' scope to fetch group memberships. Defaults to false.

groups.description: List of GitLab group names. Only users in these groups will be allowed to authenticate.

name.description: Human-readable name for the connector, displayed to users during login.

redirectUri.description: Redirect URI registered in GitLab OAuth app. Must match Dex's callback URL.

useLoginAsID.description: If true, use GitLab username as the user ID. Defaults to false.

dex:resources:GoogleConnector.description: Manages a Google connector in Dex. This connector allows users to authenticate using their Google accounts and supports domain and group-based access control.

connectorId.description: Unique identifier for the Google connector.

domainToAdminEmail.description: Map of domain names to admin email addresses. Used for group lookups in Google Workspace.

groups.description: List of Google Groups. Only users in these groups will be allowed to authenticate.

hostedDomains.description: List of Google Workspace domains. Only users with email addresses in these domains will be allowed to authenticate.

name.description: Human-readable name for the connector, displayed to users during login.

promptType.description: OAuth prompt type. Valid values: 'consent' (default) or 'select_account'.

redirectUri.description: Redirect URI registered in Google OAuth app. Must match Dex's callback URL.

serviceAccountFilePath.description: Path to Google service account JSON file. Required for group-based access control.

connectorId.description: Unique identifier for the Google connector.

domainToAdminEmail.description: Map of domain names to admin email addresses. Used for group lookups in Google Workspace.

groups.description: List of Google Groups. Only users in these groups will be allowed to authenticate.

hostedDomains.description: List of Google Workspace domains. Only users with email addresses in these domains will be allowed to authenticate.

name.description: Human-readable name for the connector, displayed to users during login.

promptType.description: OAuth prompt type. Valid values: 'consent' (default) or 'select_account'.

redirectUri.description: Redirect URI registered in Google OAuth app. Must match Dex's callback URL.

serviceAccountFilePath.description: Path to Google service account JSON file. Required for group-based access control.

dex:resources:LocalConnector.description: Manages a local/builtin connector in Dex. The local connector provides username/password authentication stored in Dex's database. This is useful for testing or when you don't have an external identity provider.

connectorId.description: Unique identifier for the local connector.

enabled.description: Whether the local connector is enabled. Defaults to true.

name.description: Human-readable name for the connector, displayed to users during login.

connectorId.description: Unique identifier for the local connector.

enabled.description: Whether the local connector is enabled. Defaults to true.

name.description: Human-readable name for the connector, displayed to users during login.
